articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Chinese Vice-Premier
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Chinese Vice-Premier

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on Monday received Li Keqiang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were General of the Korean People's Army  Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C.,  the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK, and Kim Yong Il and Kim Yang Gon, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK. 
					
					 Present there from the Chinese side were You Quan, deputy secretary-general of the State Council, Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Chen Yuan, managing director of the China Development Bank, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC, Liu Tienan, deputy head of the National Development and Reform Committee, Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce, and Ning Jizhe, deputy director of the Policy Research Office of the State Council.
					
					 Kim Jong Il firmly shook his hands with Li Keqiang and had a talk with him.
					
					Li Keqiang expressed his sincerest thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for providing such significant occasion by sparing his precious time, though he was very busy leading the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 Li said that Kim Jong Il performed great feats in developing the solidarity and traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and countries on a higher stage by paying a series of visits to China in recent years.
					
					 While staying in the DPRK, I was deeply impressed to see for myself the great successes made by the fraternal Korean people in their efforts to improve the standard of people's living and  build an economic power under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il, Li said.
					
					 It is the steadfast policy of the party and government of China to consolidate and develop the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship by sincerely implementing the wide-ranging agreements reached between the top leaders of China and the DPRK, consistently holding  fast to the bilateral relations on a strategic level and from a long-term perspective and preserving the spirit of "inheriting the tradition, facing up to the future, building good-neighborly friendship and strengthening cooperation," he added.
					
					 Kim Jong Il warmly welcomed Li's visit to the DPRK and asked him to convey his warm regards to Hu Jintao and other members of the collective leadership of the CPC and the fraternal Chinese people.
					
					 He recollected with deep emotion the facts that when he was visiting Northeast China in May last year Li Keqiang came all the way to Dalian City far away from Beijing and cordially greeted him and showed all sincerity and provided every convenience and when he stopped over at Beijing in May this year, the Chinese vice-premier accompanied him during his tour and gave a grand luncheon in honor of him.
					
					 Kim Jong Il estimated the successful talks held between the governments of the two countries in Pyongyang and  expressed the willingness of the WPK and the DPRK government  to steadily boost the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and China as desired by the two parties, governments and peoples.
					
					 Li presented gifts carrying his best wishes to Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					Kim Jong Il hosted a dinner for Li.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Li Keqiang, You Quan, Zhang Zhijun, Chen Yuan, Liu Hongcai, Liu Jieyi, Liu Tienan, Chen Jian and Ning Jizhe. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Yong Il and Kim Yang Gon were present there. 
					
					 The dinner proceeded in an atmosphere over flowing with warm friendship from its beginning to its end.
					
					 Kim Jong Il warmly hugged Li and bid farewell to him.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets with Chinese Vice- Premier
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets with Chinese Vice- Premier

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Li Keqiang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, on Monday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					
					 Present there were You Quan, deputy secretary-general of the State Council, Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Chen Yuan, managing director of the China Development Bank, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., CPC, Liu Tienan, deputy head of the National Development and Reform Committee, Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce, Ning Jizhe, deputy director of the Policy Research Office of the State Council, and other suite members.
					
					 Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., WPK, Kim Song Gi, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and officials concerned.
					
					 Li Keqiang said the Sino-DPRK friendship which stood the test of history is a common treasure for the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 This friendship, provided and cultivated by the revolutionaries of the elder generation, is now developing at a new higher stage, he said, and continued:
					
					 A series of China visits paid by General Secretary Kim Jong Il and his historic meetings with General Secretary Hu Jintao marked historic events in developing the bilateral relations onto a new higher stage.
					
					  I am pleased with the great successes made by the Korean people in socialist construction.
					
					 The Chinese party and government attach utmost importance to the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 We will make efforts to boost the relations of friendship and cooperation between our two parties and the peoples of our two countries.
					
					 We heartily wish the Korean people greater success in economic construction and in the efforts to improve the standard of people's living, Li said.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid at Friendship Tower

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Li Keqiang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK laid a wreath at the Friendship Tower on Monday on the 61st anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers into the Korean front.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were You Quan, deputy secretary-general of the State Council, Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Chen Yuan, managing director of the China Development Bank, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., CPC, Liu Tienan, deputy head of the National Development and Reform Committee, Chen Jian, vice-minister of Commerce, Ning Jizhe, deputy director of the Policy Research Office of the State Council, and other suite members and staff members of the Chinese embassy here, Chinese guests staying in the DPRK, Chinese students and Chinese residents in the DPRK.
					
					 Also on hand were Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who doubles as chairman of the C.C., the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Chol, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Po Gyong, vice-minister of People's  Security, Kim Song Gi, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned. 
					
					 A wreath in the name of Li Keqiang was laid before the tower.
					
					 Wreaths in the name of the Chinese embassy here and the Central Committee of the Association of Chinese Residents in Korea were also placed. 
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the fallen CPV fighters and looked round the tower.
					
					 Li Keqiang made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Chinese Vice-Premier Visits E-Library of Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-Premier Visits E-Library of Kim Il Sung University

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Li Keqiang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, and his party on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK visited the e-library of Kim Il Sung University on Monday.
					
					 Being briefed on the e-library built into best educational science information center, the visitors toured reading halls, computer education room, remote lecture room and other rooms.
					
					 After listening to education contents at a lecture room, Li had conversation with students.
					
					 Wishing the university greater success in its educational work, he expressed belief that exchanges would be intensified between the two countries in the field of education.
					
					 At the end of the visit, he donated education facilities and books.

articles.title: Anniversary of CPV's Entry into Korean Front Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of CPV's Entry into Korean Front Observed

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the Friendship Tower Monday on the 61st anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) into the Korean front.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health and chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Chol, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Po Gyong, vice-minister of People's Security, Kim Song Gi, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Choe Hui Thae, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, and others.
					
					 Placed before the tower was a wreath in the joint name of the WPK Central Committee and the SPA Presidium and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Also laid were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, Ministry of People's Security, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Foreign Trade and the Ministry of Culture, a wreath in the joint name of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association and a wreath in the joint name of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK and the Pyongyang City People's Committee.
					
					 Written on the ribbons of wreaths were letters reading "Glory to the fallen fighters of the CPV."
					
					 The participants looked round the tower after paying a silent tribute to the memory of the fallen CPV fighters who bravely fought in the Korean front.
					
					 On the same day laid before the cemetery of the fallen CPV fighters in Hyongjesan District were a wreath in the joint name of the Hyongjesan District, Pyongyang, Committee of the WPK and the Hyongjesan District People's Committee and wreaths in the name of KPA units, the Chinese embassy here and the Central Committee of the Association of Chinese Residents in Korea.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Saudi Arabian King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Saudi Arabian King

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of sympathy to Abdullah Bin Abdul Aziz, king of Saudi Arabia, as regards the fact that Crown Prince Sultan Bin Abdul Aziz died of illness.
					
					 Kim in the message expressed deep condolences to the King and, through him, the government and people of Saudi Arabia and the bereaved family.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Zambian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Zambian President

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Michael Chilufya Sata, president of Zambia, on the 47th anniversary of its independence.
					
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Zambia would grow stronger in various fields.
					
					 He sincerely wished the friendly Zambian people prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to President of Cameroon
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Cameroon

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Paul Biya upon his reelection as president of Cameroon.
					
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the president greater success in his work for the development of the country and its national unity.

articles.title: Those from South Hamgyong Province Leave
articles.content:
Innovators from South Hamgyong Province Leave

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Officials, labor innovators, scientists and technicians from South Hamgyong Province left Pyongyang on Monday at the end of their tour of it.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary and officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, saw them off at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel.
					
					 People from all walks of life warmly sent them off along the route from the Hotel to Pyongyang Railway Station.
					
					 The citizens and innovators from South Hamgyong Province felt deeply grateful to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for commending them and made them well known to the whole country in high recognition of what was done by the common people.
					
					  Buses carrying the innovators departed from Pyongyang amid the warm blessing by citizens.
					
					 Meanwhile, the innovators on their way home after visiting Pyongyang were given warm send-off along the road in Wonsan City by working people in the city.
					
					 When they arrived at Hamhung City on Monday evening, they were greeted by Kwak Pom Gi, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, officials of the party, power and economic organs, working people's organizations of the province and working people and school youth and children in Hamhung city. 
					
					 They visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Tonghungsan Hill in Hamhung city.

articles.title: Reception Hosted on UN Day
articles.content:
Reception Hosted on UN Day 

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Jerome Sauvage, resident coordinator of the United Nations to the DPRK, hosted a reception at Yanggakdo International Hotel on Monday to observe the Day of the United Nations. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Kil Yon, officials concerned and foreign diplomatic envoys here. 
					
					 Representatives of international organizations here were on hand. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: 63rd Anniversary of Opening of DPRK-Romania Diplomatic Ties Marked
articles.content:
63rd Anniversary of Opening of DPRK-Romania Diplomatic Ties Marked

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A film show took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday to observe the 63rd anniversary of the opening of the DPRK-Romania diplomatic relations.
					
					 Present there were Ryu Sung Rim, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Romania Friendship Association, officials concerned, working people in the city of Pyongyang, Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Mititelu Neculae Cristian and staff members of the Romanian embassy here. 
					
					 The participants watched the Romanian feature film "Broadcasting Goes on".

articles.title: Poet O Yong Jae Dies
articles.content:
Poet O Yong Jae Dies 

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Poet O Yong Jae, winner of Kim Il Sung Prize and the title of Labor Hero, died of the thyroid cancer at the age of 75 on Sunday.
					
					 Hailing from the southern half of Korea, O joined the Korean People's Army and bravely fought in sacred battles during the Fatherland Liberation War against the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 He has worked in the field of literature and arts for years with boundless loyalty to the party and the leader and ardent love for the socialist country.
					
					 He wrote words of songs "Old Home Covered with Snow", "Smile with Love" and "Family of General", a lyric poem "Sun of All People", a poem "Declaration of Avenger" and many other literary works of high ideological and artistic value, making a great contribution to the development of poetry in the DPRK and educating the people in the revolutionary idea. 
					
					 He was awarded Kim Il Sung Prize, the title of Labor Hero and many other state commendations for his feats performed in the development of the Juche-based literature. 
					
					 His obituary was released by the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on Sunday.
					
					 Though O died, the feats he performed for the country and the people will always be remembered, it said.

articles.title: Title of Labor Hero Conferred on Farmer
articles.content:
Title of Labor Hero Conferred on Farmer

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The title of Labor Hero was awarded to Ri Song Jin, former farmer of the 5th workteam of the Songho Co-op Farm in Yonan County, South Hwanghae Province, who was a model farmer in the era of Songun. 
					
					He devotedly worked for the increased crop production true to his duty as befitting a patriotic farmer responsible for the nation's agriculture and saved valuable assets of the co-op farm by throwing himself into the torrents of the river when pasture was inundated by heavy rain and draught oxen were washed away.
					
					 He was awarded the title of Labor Hero of the DPRK and Gold Medal (hammer and sickle) and Order of National Flag (first class) according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly dated October 21.

articles.title: Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu Awarded in Peru
articles.content:
Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu Awarded in Peru

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) --  Ancon County, Lima Province in Peru presented the title of honorary citizenship and key of the county to President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk on the 66th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union. 
					
					 A ceremony of conveying the decision on registering the three commanders of Mt. Paektu as honorary citizens and presenting the key of the county took place at the Ancon County Office building on Oct. 17. 
					
					 Pedro John Barrera, governor of Ancon County, said at the ceremony that the Korean people built the country centered on the popular masses, holding aloft the banner of the Juche idea under the leadership of the great leaders and the great party. 
					
					 Noting that the DPRK serves as a beacon for the world people desirous of independence, he went on:
					
					 The Ancon County Office decided to register the three commanders of Mt. Paektu of Korea as honorary citizens and present the key of the county to them in recognition of their immortal exploits performed for the human cause of independence 
					
					 Then the decision and key of the county were conveyed to the DPRK ambassador to Peru. 
					
					 Present there were Luis Cuadros, organizational secretary of the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru; Estuardo Martinez Perez, curator of the Pyongyang Cultural Center in Peru; Felix Fernandes Torres, secretary general of the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea; and other political and public personages and masses.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Beijing Service Bureau for Diplomatic Missions of China headed by Deputy Director-General Lu Huizao arrived here by air on Monday.
					
					 The delegation of the China Meteorological Administration led by Deputy Administrator Yu Xinwen went back home on the same day.

articles.title: Vietnamese Party Official Reiterates Efforts to Boost Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Vietnamese Party Official Reiterates Efforts to Boost Friendly Relations with DPRK

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Hoang Binh Quan, chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Vietnamese Communist Party, who led the delegation of the Party, gave his impressions of the DPRK.
					
					 He said:
					
					 While staying in the DPRK, we saw the Korean people waging a dynamic struggle to implement the behest of President Kim Il Sung under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The people of the DPRK have registered great successes in socialist construction.
					
					 The two parties and countries of Vietnam and the DPRK have good friendly relations. 
					
					 The party and government of the DPRK extended unstinted support and encouragement to Vietnam in its national liberation struggle, cause of reunification and socialist construction.
					
					 We will never forget this.
					
					 The party, the government and the people of Vietnam attach great importance to the friendly relations with the DPRK.
					
					 The friendly relations between Vietnam and the DPRK are growing stronger under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 We set store by these friendly relations and will make positive efforts to boost them.

articles.title: Football Match Held between Russian, Brazilian Teams
articles.content:
Football Match Held between Russian, Brazilian Teams 

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A men's football match was held between the Ska-Engery Club team of Khabarovsk, Russia and the Atletico Sorocaba Club team of Brazil at Yanggakdo Football Stadium in Pyongyang on Monday.
					
					 The Atletico Sorocaba Club team won the match 2:0.

articles.title: DPRK Rich in Vermiculite Resources
articles.content:
DPRK Rich in Vermiculite Resources

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea is abundant in vermiculite resources.
					
					 The country has deposits of several hundred million tons of vermiculite, as well as favorable mining conditions.
					
					 The grade of vermiculite in the country is as high as 70-90 percent, free from asbestos.
					
					 It is less than 7 percent in content of iron oxide and more than 21 percent in content of magnesium.
					
					 The country has paid deep attention to making a rational use of vermiculite resources.
					
					 There is an expanded vermiculite producer in Sunchon City, South Phyongan Province.
					
					 Expanded vermiculite is widely used as sound arresting, moisture preventing and lagging materials for dwelling houses and public buildings.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Democratic Reform of UN
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Democratic Reform of UN 

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- If the United Nations is to increase its leading role in settling global problems it is necessary to carry out democratic reforms of it, observes Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article dedicated to the Day of the UN. 
					
					 The UN should be reformed in such a way as to fully ensure democracy and impartiality in its activities, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The reform of the UN Security Council is an important part of the UN reform. 
					
					 It is the unanimous assertion of its member nations that the UNSC should be reformed on the principle of fully ensuring the representation of non-aligned and other developing countries which account for an overwhelming majority of the UN member nations. 
					
					 It is equally important to decisively increase the authority of the UN General Assembly. The authority of the UN General Assembly which is of most democratic nature in the UN remains weaker than that of the UNSC. Such deformed situation should not be allowed to go on any longer. 
					
					 It is essential to urgently establish the system whereby the resolutions of the UNSC concerning peace and security including imposing sanctions and use of force should come into force only with the approval of the UN General Assembly. 
					
					 20 years have passed since the DPRK joined the UN. 
					
					 The DPRK remains unchanged in its assertion and stand to ensure global peace and security and soundly develop international relations by reforming the UN in a fair and democratic way and enhancing its role and functions. 
					
					 The international community will show deeper trust in the UN when it solves all the global problems in a fair and reasonable way on the principle of justice and equality to meet the need of the times and desire and wishes of mankind.

articles.title: Second Demo under Slogan "Occupy Seoul!" Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Second Demo under Slogan "Occupy Seoul!" Launched in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The second rally against exploitation and oppression by capital under the slogan "Occupy Seoul!" was staged in the plaza of Seoul City Office on Saturday, according to the south Korean MBC. 
					
					 The ralliers urged the authorities to take steps to put down the capital's speculation.
					
					 They demanded halt to the scheme to conclude the FTA with the U.S. and urgent solution to the social problems.
					
					 Earlier, the Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally for getting the part-time job system repealed in the same place. It stressed the urgency of ensuring the three rights of labor and employment.

articles.title: Responsible Decision on Jeju Island Naval Base Construction Urged
articles.content:
Responsible Decision on Jeju Island Naval Base Construction Urged

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The General Council of the Christian Presbyterian Church in south Korea sent all lawmakers a letter on Oct. 20 clarifying the stand of opposing the naval base construction on Jeju Island.
					
					 The organization in its letter quoted experts as saying that the naval base would serve as a lever to pressurize the countries around south Korea.
					
					 The Jeju Island would turn into the most dangerous area of military conflict in Northeast Asia, it noted, calling upon all lawmakers to make a responsible decision on peace on the Korean Peninsula, properly understanding the gravity of the construction.

articles.title: Attempt to Quell People's Praise of DPRK Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Attempt to Quell People's Praise of DPRK Censured in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, Internet newspaper of south Korea, posted an article slamming the puppet group for its despicable action to quell the people's mindset in favor of the north.
					
					 The article accused the authorities of conducting a wholesale investigation into more than 70 people of various social standings including government employees, lawyers and professors these day on charges that they praised the north.
					
					 It is very shocking that so many people of broad strata are joining the ranks of pro-north supporters, it noted.
					
					 The article recalled that the above-said people in their articles posted on internet websites praised the history of the anti-Japanese armed struggle waged by President Kim Il Sung and the exploits performed by Chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il and its military capability and scientific and technological achievements. They also spoke highly of the dignified diplomacy pursued by the DPRK, leading by the nose the U.S., a rogue state of imperialism engrossed in all sorts of arbitrary practices in various parts of the world.
					
					 It is barbarous for the authorities to quell the daily growing voices of the people praising the north, concluded the article.

articles.title: Authorities' Unpopular Rule under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Unpopular Rule under Fire in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kang Ki Gap, a lawmaker from the Democratic Labor Party in south Korea, disclosed the aftermath of the puppet authorities' unpopular rule on October 21.
					
					   Since coming to power, the present authorities have set forth policies related to real property but most of them are for tax reduction of the rich and there was no substantial step for the homeless common people, he said.
					
					 They widened polarization of society with the policy for big businesses and are now seeking to drive the economy into an irretrievable situation with conclusion of the "Free Trade Agreement" with the U.S., he pointed out.
					
					 Even under the present serious situation the authorities are calling for ratification of the agreement that will take the people's lives, he charged, declaring that his party would check it at any cost.

articles.title: Anniversary of WPK Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of WPK Celebrated Abroad

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to mark the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU). They included meetings, reading sessions, lectures, photo exhibitions and film shows in Germany, India, Guinea, Nigeria and Ethiopia.
					
					 Displayed in their venues were photos on the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and books and photos showing the validity and vitality of the Songun politics.
					
					 Korean films shown included "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu".
					
					  The chief of the Hannover Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Germany said in a meeting that since its founding the WPK which inherited the tradition of the DIU has covered the road of victory despite all sorts of interference and aggression moves of the imperialists.
					
					 The people of the DPRK would surely hit the high goal of building a thriving country under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, he said.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chief of the Guinean Group for the Study of February 16 Art, at a reading session praised the undying feats performed by Kim Il Sung for party building.
					
					 The President's feats will shine long with the invincible dignity of the WPK, he stressed.
					
					 Former Deputy President of the National Assembly of Nigeria Ibrahim Mantu, who is member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party, said that the Korean people are speeding up the building of a thriving nation full of conviction and optimism under the leadership of the WPK. We will conduct the vigorous activities for supporting the struggle of the WPK and the Korean people, he declared.
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Il was adopted at an event in Germany.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Foreign Media

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Media of different countries observed the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The Russian paper Patriot carried in its 38th issue an article titled "Party of leader and people" with a photo of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK is advancing towards the future with confidence as it has the WPK founded by Kim Il Sung and led by Kim Jong Il, the paper said.
					
					 The WPK is a revolutionary party guided by the progressive idea and a party representing the interests of the working class and all other people, it added.
					
					 The paper also edited a photo of the Party Founding Memorial Tower in Pyongyang.
					
					 The Ugandan paper Sun Rise on October 10 carried an article titled "On 66th anniversary of WPK" with a photo of Kim Jong Il, which stressed that the WPK would always emerge victorious under the guidance of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 This country's national radio and Syria's central TV channel and radio aired special reports on the anniversary of the WPK on the same day.

articles.title: Anniversary of WPK Marked in China and Peru
articles.content:
Anniversary of WPK Marked in China and Peru

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and fine art exhibitions were opened in Inner Mongolian Autonomous Region of China and Lima Province of Peru on October 17 and 19 to mark the 66th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 On display in their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos showing their exploits. 
					
					 Also exhibited were photos on the historic Conference of the WPK and celebrations of its 65th birthday, books, photos and multimedia introducing Songun Korea and fine art works associated with the creative wisdom and skills of the Korean people.
					
					 Speeches were made at their opening ceremonies.
					
					 Meanwhile a Korean fine art exhibition was opened in Dandong City of China on October 18.

articles.title: Chinese Paper Introduces DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Paper Introduces DPRK

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The Chinese paper People's Daily on October 19 carried its delegation's travelogue on the DPRK under the title of "Lot of changes in standard of people's living close at hand."
					
					 The appearance of Pyongyang witnessed by the delegation was friendly and exciting one, the travelogue noted, and continued:
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the DPRK pay primary attention to the work for improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 Housing construction is making brisk headway in various parts of the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean people are dynamically advancing to fling open the gate to a thriving nation. 
					
					 It said that the WPK and the DPRK government are paying deep attention to the light industry and agriculture to steadily improve the standard of people's living and that citizens' dressing is becoming more beautiful and their life more bountiful as the days go by. 
					
					 It also referred in detail to the delegation's impressions of the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill, the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Venezuela
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Venezuela

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is a Juche-Type Revolutionary Party Which Inherited the Glorious Tradition of the DIU" was brought out in pamphlet by Canta Clara Publishing House of Venezuela on October 15.
					
					 The work, published on October 17, Juche 71 (1982), clarifies the significance of the founding of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU), the feats of the Workers' Party of Korea and the features of the WPK which carved out a new path for its development.

articles.title: China Calls for Preventing Space Militarization
articles.content:
China Calls for Preventing Space Militarization

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Wang Qun, Chinese disarmament ambassador, urged the international community to make effort to prevent space militarization, a media report said.
					
					 Speaking at the recently held UN General Assembly meeting, Wang said that to ensure a peaceful use of space and prevent space militarization and arms race is what conforms with common interests of all nations and what they should be jointly responsible for.
					
					 With the danger of space militarization and arms race steadily getting serious, indefinite factors related to the space security are increasing, the ambassador said.
					
					 Therefore the international community should make a new international legal document for preventing space militarization through talks as soon as possible, Wang added.

articles.title: China's Effort to Improve People's Living Standard
articles.content:
China's Effort to Improve People's Living Standard

					 Beijing, October 23 (KCNA) -- A vice-premier of the State Council of China expressed the Chinese government's willingness to make sustained efforts to improve the people's living standard.
					
					 Addressing the opening ceremony of a forum held in Beijing recently, Hui Liangyu stressed that to improve the people's living standard is a steadfast goal of the government.
					
					 The state will provide the people suffering from poverty with compulsory education, basic medical service and dwelling houses by 2020, Hui added.

articles.title: Russia's Carrier Rocket Launched
articles.content:
Russia's Carrier Rocket Launched 

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Russia's carrier rocket "Soyuz-ST -B" was launched from the space center in French Guiana on Friday, according to the French State Space Research Center. 
					
					 The rocket carried two navigation satellites of Galileo, Europe's GPS (Global Position System).

articles.title: Russian President Calls for Intensifying Road Management
articles.content:
Russian President Calls for Intensifying Road Management 

					 Moscow, October 23 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev recently called for intensifying the road management in his congratulatory message to officials of this field on their holiday.       
					
					 In the message the president said the road networks are of great importance in developing the economy and carrying out social tasks in the present age.    
					
					 With Russia seeking a fresh technological development, it is necessary to modernize the road management and improve motorways, he added.
					
					 The president also underscored the need to pay special attention to training highly skilled experts and introducing other nations' advanced experience in an effective way.

articles.title: Fidel Castro Chides U.S. and West
articles.content:
Fidel Castro Chides U.S. and West

					 Havana, October 23 (KCNA) -- Fidel Castro, leader of the Cuban revolution, in a recent article posted on Internet website chided the U.S. and Western countries for bringing humankind to disaster.
					
					 The article said that mankind may suffer irrevocable disaster due to the U.S. ruling quarters and munitions monopoly plutocrats controlling the country, underscoring the need to save humankind from this disaster.
					
					 The article recalled that the people who have been exploited by financial oligarchic politicians in Western countries with each passing day are turning out in the struggle for their right to existence. 
					
					 If the developing countries of Asia, Africa and Latin America pool their efforts in economic and technological aspects, it is possible to save humankind from disaster, concluded the article.

articles.title: Tainted Food Causes Deaths in U.S.
articles.content:
Tainted Food Causes Deaths in U.S.

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Tainted food in the U.S. has caused a great loss of human lives, arousing public criticism.
					
					 The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Wednesday that about 48 million people in the U.S. each year get sick from tainted food, with 3,000 deaths.

articles.title: Sluggish Economy in U.S., Japan
articles.content:
Sluggish Economy in U.S., Japan

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- U.S. existing-home sales in September across the country dropped 3 percent as compared with the previous month, the U.S. National Association of Realtors reported on Thursday
					
					 Meanwhile, Japan's convenience store sales in September fell 4 percent from a year earlier.
					
					 Those declines were due to the slump of residents' purchasing power by depressed economy.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- China and Poland on October 21 agreed to develop military exchange and cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 On the same day India and Nepal signed an agreement on cooperation in the field of investment.

articles.title: Cholera Cases Increase in Haiti
articles.content:
Cholera Cases Increase in Haiti

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The number of Cholera cases is increasing in Haiti.
					
					 As of October 21 this year, the cumulative number of the reported cholera cases was 469,967, of which 6,595 persons had died.
					
					 Measures have been taken to prevent the spread of this disease.

articles.title: Turkey Condemns Israel for East Jerusalem Settlement Plan
articles.content:
Turkey Condemns Israel for East Jerusalem Settlement Plan

					 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Turkey strongly condemned Israel over reports that it plans to build 2,600 more housing units in East Jerusalem, the Turkish Foreign Ministry said in a statement on Thursday.
					
					 The move by Israel would threaten to cut a link between Jerusalem and the West Bank and endanger the already slim peace prospects, it noted.
					
					 It said the latest settlement plan gives a serious clue over Israel's goals on occupation and annexation of occupied Palestinian territories.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il ofrece banquete en honor de innovadores laborales
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il ofrece banquete en honor de innovadores laborales

					ã€€Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, ofrecio el solemne banquete en honor de los funcionarios, innovadores laborales, cientificos y tecnicos de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					
					ã€€A la recepcion fueron invitados los de los Complejos de Vinalon "8 de Febrero", de Abonos de Hungnam y de Maquinaria de Ryongsong, la Fundicion de Metales no Ferrosos de Hungnam, la Mina Heroina Juventud de Taehung, la Mina de Ryongyang, la Fabrica de Magnesia de Tanchon, el Campo de Construccion del Puerto de Tanchon, la Granja Fruticola de Ryongjon y la Granja Cooperativa de Tongbong del distrito de Hamju de esta provincia.
					
					ã€€Kim Jong Il felicito calurosamente a quines abrieron la brecha en el cumplimiento del plan de la economia nacional y lograron orgullosos exitos en la labor para consolidar la base economica del pais.
					
					ã€€En la recepcion el discurso estuvo a cargo de Pak To Chun, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					ã€€El orador senalo que el Dirigente oriento con gran proyecto a reconstruir, modernizar varias fabricas y empresas casi no funcionadas y conquistar la tecnologia de punta dedicando todos sus esfuerzos y trabajos y cuando se lograron exitos los devolvio a los funcionarios, obreros, cientificos y tecnicos de la provincia.
					
					ã€€Para responder a la gran benevolencia del Dirigente los participantes se decidieron a materializar cabalmente el proposito del partido de abrir la puerta del Estado prospero al frente de la marcha victoriosa hacia 2012, ano del centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					ã€€Participaron en la recepcion los funcionarios directivos de los organos del partido y las fuerzas Armadas: Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk y otros integrantes del Buro Politico, miembros del CC del Partido y de la CMC, del PTC, asi como los funcionarios del CDN e instituciones de las fuerzas armadas.

articles.title: En Pyongyang Li Keqiang
articles.content:
En Pyongyang Li Keqiang

					ã€€Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Llego el dia 23 a esta capital por el avion de uso particular Li Keqiang, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China quien realiza una visita oficial y de amistad a Corea cumplimentando la invitacion del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					  Vinieron junto con el tambien el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado You Quan, el viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores Zhang Zhijun, el director administrador del Banco Nacional de Desarrollo Chen Yuan, el subjefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Liu Jieyi, el subjefe de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Liu Tienan, el viceministro de Comercio Chen Jian, el subdirector de la Oficina de Estudio de Politica del Consejo de Estado Ning Jizhe y otros acompanantes.
					
					  En el aeropuerto acogieron a los huespedes chinos el miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros Kang Sok Ju, el miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario  del CC del PTC Kim Yong Il, el miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang Mun Kyong Dok, el vicecanciller Kim Song Gi y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					  Ademas, figuraban alli el embajador chino Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica en Corea.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Li Keqiang
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Li Keqiang

					ã€€Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio este lunes en un ambiente amistoso en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Li Keqiang, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China (RPCh), quien le realizo una visita de cortesia.
					
					ã€€Estuvieron presentes el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado You Quan, el viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores Zhang Zhijun, el director administrador del Banco Nacional de Desarrollo Chen Yuan, el embajador de la RPCh en Corea Liu Hongcai, el subjefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Liu Jieyi, el subjefe de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Liu Tienan, el viceministro de Comercio Chen Jian, el subdirector de la Oficina de Estudio de Politica del Consejo de Estado Ning Jizhe y otros acompanantes.
					
					ã€€Tambien participaron Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central de PTC y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC, Kim Yong Il, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, el vicecanciller Kim Song Gi, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					ã€€En la ocasion, Li Keqiang senalo que la amistad China-Corea, que supero todas las pruebas y tempestades de la historia, deviene la riqueza comun de los pueblos de los dos paises, y continuo:
					
					ã€€La amistad China-Corea preparada por los revolucionarios de veterana generacion se intensifica hoy en dia en una nueva etapa  alta.
					
					ã€€La visita a China del camarada Secretario General  Kim Jong Il realizada en varias veces y el historico encuentro con su homologo Hu Jintao fueron el acontecimiento historico que asento en una nueva etapa alta las relaciones entre los dos paises.
					
					ã€€Me alegro mucho de que el pueblo coreano logra notables exitos en la construccion socialista.
					
					ã€€El partido y el gobierno de China aprecian  en alto grado la amistad China-Corea.
					
					 Nos esforzaremos por desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos partidos y pueblos.
					
					ã€€Por ultimo, deseo de todo corazon al pueblo coreano mayores exitos en su lucha por la construccion economica y la mejora de la vida del pueblo.

articles.title: Li Keqiang deposita ofrenda floral ante el Monumento a la Amistad
articles.content:
Li Keqiang deposita ofrenda floral ante el Monumento a la Amistad 

					ã€€Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Li Keqiang, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, quien realiza una visita oficial y de amistad a Corea, deposito el dia 24 una ofrenda floral ante el Monumento a la Amistad en ocasion del 61o aniversario de la participacion del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en el frente coreano.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado You Quan, el viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores Zhang Zhijun, el director administrador del Banco Nacional de Desarrollo Chen Yuan, el embajador chino en Corea Liu Hongcai, el subjefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Liu Jieyi, el subjefe de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Liu Tienan, el viceministro de Comercio Chen Jian, el subdirector de la Oficina de Estudio de Politica del Consejo de Estado Ning Jizhe y otros acompanantes, los miembros de la embajada china en Corea, los huespedes chinos que permanecen en Corea, los estudiantes chinos en Corea y los chinos que viven en Corea.
					
					  Alli participaron el miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Yang Hyong Sop, el ministro de Salud Publica y presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-China Choe Chang Sik, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Kim Song Nam, el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Kim Chol, el viceministro de Seguridad del Pueblo Kim Po Gyong, el vicecanciller Kim Song Gi, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae,  el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero Kim Jin Bom y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					  Fue colocada ante el Monumento a la Amistad la ofrenda floral en nombre de Li Keqiang, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PCCh y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la RPCh.
					
					  Fueron depositadas tambien las ofrendas florales en nombre de la embajada china en Corea y el Comite Central de la Asociacion de los Chinos Residentes en Corea.
					
					  Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino y recorrieron el monumento.
					
					  Li Keqiang dejo las letras en el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Li Keqiang visita biblioteca electronica de Universidad Kim Il Sun
articles.content:
Li Keqiang visita biblioteca electronica de Universidad Kim Il Sung 

					ã€€Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Li Keqiang, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, y su comitiva, de visita oficial y de amistad en Corea, visitaron el dia 24 la Biblioteca Electronica de la Universidad Kim Il Sung. 
					
					ã€€Los huespedes recorrieron los vestibulos de lectura, las salas de ensenanza de computacion, de lecciones a larga distancia, etc., escuchando las explicaciones sobre el hecho de que la Biblioteca Electronica se ha acondicionado magnificamente como base de servicio de informaciones docentes y cientificas.
					
					ã€€Tras oir la leccion departio con los estudiantes. 
					
					ã€€Deseo mayores exitos en el trabajo docente de la Universidad y expreso la conviccion de que se activara mas el intercambio entre los dos paises en el dominio de educacion. 
					
					ã€€Al termino de la visita, Li Keqiang dono los equipos docentes y libros.

articles.title: Depositadas ofrendas florales ante Monumento a la Amistad
articles.content:
Depositadas ofrendas florales ante Monumento a la Amistad

					ã€€Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 61o aniversario de la participacion del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en el frente coreano, fueron depositadas este lunes las ofrendas florales ante el Monumento a la Amistad.
					
					ã€€Participaron en la ceremonia el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Yang Hyong Sop, el ministro de Salud Publica y presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-China Choe Chang Sik, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Kim Song Nam, el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Kim Chol, el viceministro de Seguridad del Pueblo Kim Po Gyong, el vicecanciller Kim Song Gi, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae, el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero Kim Jin Bom, el vicepresidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang Choe Hui Thae, etc.
					
					ã€€Quedo colocada una ofrenda floral en nombre comun del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					ã€€Tambien fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales en nombre de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, el Ministerio de Comercio Exterior y el Ministerio de Cultura, la ofrenda floral en nombre comun del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y el Comite Central de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-China y la otra en nombre comun del Comite del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en la Ciudad de Pyongyang y el Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					ã€€En las cintas de ofrendas florales se veia la inscripcion "!Gloria a los martires del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino!"
					
					ã€€Tras guardar un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires del citado cuerpo quienes lucharon valientemente en el frente coreano, los participantes recorrieron el monumento.
					
					ã€€El mismo dia, fueron colocadas ante las tumbas de martires del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en el capitalino municipio de Hyongjesan una ofrenda floral en nombre comun del Comite del PTC en el Municipio de Hyongjesan y el Comite Popular del Municipio de Hyongjesan, de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, la otra en nombre de la unidad del Ejercito Popular de Corea y la tercera en nombre de la embajada china en Corea y el Comite Central de la Asociacion de Chinos Residentes en Corea.
